page.title: 09Proj 3 Wildlife of the area
page.content:
Wildlife around Torpoint.
On Friday May 24th, Mr.Steven Madge,the well known naturalist and ornitholgist, came to give us a talk on the wildlife of the area around Torpoint. We are fortunate to have a very mild climate owing to the fact that the Gulf Stream runs close to the shore.This means that the temperature at sea level almost never falls below freezing,so many plants grow here that could not grow anywhere else.Our seashore area has 2 large esturaies of the Lynher and Tamar rivers with there entensive mudflats which provide enormous quantities of food for wading and other water birds.This means there is a varied resident population which includes Robins and Blackbirds which are migratory in colder climates.
